oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Sunday Down South - 1940-11-17 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: NBC syndication Sunday Down South, originating from WSM. Originally broadcast 1940-11-17, part 1. Personnel include Louie Buck (host), Beasley Smith (conductor), Kitty Kallen (performer), Mac McGar (performer), Paul Benson (performer), and Betty and the Dixie Dons (performer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Beasley Smith; Kitty Kallen; Mac McGar; Paul Benson; Alcyone Bate Beasley; Dixie Dons
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Theme -- Opening statement (Louie Buck) -- Darktown Strutters' Ball (Beasley Smith and his Orchestra) -- Louie Buck introduces Kitty Kallen -- When You Awake (Kitty Kallen) -- Louie Buck introduces Mac McGar -- [Unidentified fiddle tune] (Mac McGar fiddle, Beasley Smith and his Orchestra) -- Louie Buck introduces Paul Benson -- There I Go (Paul Benson) -- Louie Buck talks -- South Rampart Street Parade (Beasley Smith and his Orchestra) -- Louie Buck introduces Betty and the Dixie Dons -- My Gal [title unconfirmed] (Betty and the Dixie Dons)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Sunday down south (Radio program); Buck, Louis, 1910-1971; Smith, Beasley; Kallen, Kitty; Beasley, Alcyone; Dixie Dons (Musical group); McGar, Mac
